docs.text: Firebase Database ¶ Category Version Requires Google 4 API 19 Non-visible component Overview ¶ Non-visible component that communicates with a Firebase to store and retrieve information. Events ¶ Data Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type tag text value any Indicates that the data in the Firebase has changed Launches an event with the tag and value that have been updated. Firebase Error ¶ Parameters Name Type message text Indicates that the communication with the Firebase signaled an error. First Removed ¶ Parameters Name Type value any Event triggered by the "RemoveFirst" function. The argument "value" is the object that was the first in the list, and which is now removed. Got Value ¶ Parameters Name Type tag text value any Indicates that a GetValue request has succeeded. Tag List ¶ Parameters Name Type value list Event triggered when we have received the list of known tags. Used with the "GetTagList" Function. Methods ¶ AppendValue ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type tag text value To Add any Append a value to the end of a list atomically. If two devices use this function simultaneously, both will be appended and no data lost. ClearTag ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type tag text Remove the tag from Firebase GetTagList ¶ Block preview not available Get the list of tags for this application. When complete a "TagList" event will be triggered with the list of known tags. GetValue ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type tag text value If Tag Not There any GetValue asks Firebase to get the value stored under the given tag It will pass valueIfTagNotThere to GotValue if there is no value storedunder the tag. GoOffline ¶ Block preview not available Take the database offline GoOnline ¶ Block preview not available Take the database online RemoveFirst ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type tag text Return the first element of a list and atomically remove it. If two devices use this function simultaneously, one will get the first element and the the other will get the second element, or an error if there is no available element. When the element is available, the "FirstRemoved" event will be triggered. StoreValue ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type tag text value To Store any Asks Firebase to store the given value under the given tag. Unauthenticate ¶ Block preview not available If you are having difficulty with the Companion and you are switching between different Firebase accounts, you may need to use this function to clear internal Firebase caches. You can just use the "Do It" function on this block in the blocks editor. Note: You should not normally need to use this block as part of an application. Properties ¶ Default URL ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text No description available Developer Bucket ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Getter for the DeveloperBucket. Firebase Token ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Returns the FirebaseToken from this FirebaseDB. Firebase URL ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text DEFAULT Gets the URL for this FirebaseDB. Persist ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, variables will retain their values when off-line and the App exits. Values will be uploaded to Firebase the next time the App is run while connected to the network. This is useful for applications which will gather data while not connected to the network. Note: AppendValue and RemoveFirst will not work correctly when off-line, they require a network connection. Note : If you set Persist on any Firebase component, on any screen, it makes all Firebase components on all screens persistent. This is a limitation of the low level Firebase library. Also be aware that if you want to set persist to true, you should do so before connecting the Companion for incremental development. Project Bucket ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Gets the ProjectBucket for this FirebaseDB.

docs.text: Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, variables will retain their values when off-line and the App exits. Values will be uploaded to Firebase the next time the App is run while connected to the network. This is useful for applications which will gather data while not connected to the network. Note: AppendValue and RemoveFirst will not work correctly when off-line, they require a network connection. Note : If you set Persist on any Firebase component, on any screen, it makes all Firebase components on all screens persistent. This is a limitation of the low level Firebase library. Also be aware that if you want to set persist to true, you should do so before connecting the Companion for incremental development.
docs.title: Persist

docs.text: Google Maps ¶ Category Version Requires Google 4 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that shows a map on the screen powered by Google''s Maps service. Events ¶ Camera Position Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type lat number lng number bearing number tilt number zoom number Called after the camera position of a map has changed. Finished Dragging Circle ¶ Parameters Name Type id number center Lat number center Lng number radius number Event been raised after the action of moving a draggable circle is finished. Possible a user drag the center of the circle or drag the radius marker of the circle Info Window Clicked ¶ Parameters Name Type marker Id number When the marker's infowindow is clicked, returning marker's id Map Is Ready ¶ Indicates that the map has been rendered and ready for adding markers or changing other settings. Please add or updating markers within this event On Location Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type lat number lng number Triggers this event when user location has changed. Only works when EnableMylocation is set to true On Map Click ¶ Parameters Name Type lat number lng number Called when the user makes a tap gesture on the map On Map Long Click ¶ Parameters Name Type lat number lng number Called when the user makes a long-press gesture on the map On Marker Click ¶ Parameters Name Type marker Id number latitude number longitude number When a marker is clicked On Marker Drag ¶ Parameters Name Type marker Id number latitude number longitude number When a marker is been dragged On Marker Drag End ¶ Parameters Name Type marker Id number latitude number longitude number When the user drags a marker and finish the action, returning marker's id and it's latest position On Marker Drag Start ¶ Parameters Name Type marker Id number latitude number longitude number When a marker starts been dragged On Point Of Interest Click ¶ Parameters Name Type lat number lng number place Name text place ID text This event will be invoked when a user clicks on a point of interest. This can be a shop, coffee-bar or else. Methods ¶ AddCircle ¶ Block preview not available Returns `number` Parameters Name Type lat number lng number radius number alpha number hue number stroke Width number stroke Color number draggable boolean Create a circle overlay on the map UI with specified latitude and longitude for center. "hue" (min 0, max 360) and "alpha" (min 0, max 255) are used to set color and transparency level of the circle, "strokeWidth" and "strokeColor" are for the perimeter of the circle. Returning a unique id of the circle for future reference to events raised by moving this circle. If the circle isset to be draggable, two default markers will appear on the map: one in the center of the circle, another on the perimeter. AddMarkers ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` Parameters Name Type markers list Adding a list of YailLists for markers. The representation of a maker in the inner YailList is composed of: lat(double) [required], long(double) [required], Color, title(String), snippet(String), draggable(boolean). Return a list of unqiue ids for the added markers. Note that the markers ids are not meant to persist after the app is closed, but for temporary references to the markers within the program only. Return an empty list if any error happen in the input AddMarkersFromJson ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type json String text Adding a list of markers that are represented as JsonArray. The inner JsonObject represents a markerand is composed of name-value pairs. Name fields for a marker are: "lat" (type double) [required], "lng"(type double) [required], "color"(type int)[in hue value ranging from 0~360], "title"(type String), "snippet"(type String), "draggable"(type boolean) AddMarkersHue ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` Parameters Name Type markers list Adding a list of YailList for markers. The inner YailList represents a marker and is composed of lat(Double) [required], long(Double) [required], color(int)[in hue value ranging from 0-360], title(String), snippet(String), draggable(boolean). Return a list of unique ids for the markers that are added AddPolyline ¶ Block preview not available Returns `number` Parameters Name Type points list width number color number This block will return the unique id of the new added polyline. Create a new polyline on the map. Use for 'points' a list of lat, lng pairs. A integer for the 'width' (in pixel) and a valid color for the 'color' parameter. BoundCamera ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type ne Lat number ne Lng number sw Lat number sw Lng number Transforms the camera such that the specified latitude/longitude bounds are centered on screen at the greatest possible zoom level. Need to specify both latitudes and longitudes for both northeast location and southwest location of the bounding box EnableCompass ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enable boolean Enables/disables the compass widget on the map's ui. Call this only after event "MapIsReady" is received EnableMapCameraPosChangeListener ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enabled boolean Enable/Disable to listen to map's camera position changed event EnableMapClickListener ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enabled boolean Enable/Disable to listen to map's click event EnableMapLongClickListener ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enabled boolean Enable/disable to listen to map's long click event EnableMyLocation ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enabled boolean Enable or disable my location widget control for Google Map. One can call GetMyLocation() to obtain the current location after enable this." EnableRotate ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enable boolean Enables/disables the capability to rotate a map on the ui. Call this only after the event "MapIsReady" is received. EnableScroll ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enable boolean Enables/disables the capability to scroll a map on the ui. Call this only after the event "MapIsReady" is received EnableZoomControl ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enable boolean Enables/disables the zoom widget on the map's ui. Call this only after the event "MapIsReady" is received EnableZoomGesture ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type enable boolean Enables/disables zoom gesture on the map ui. Call this only after the event "MapIsReady" is received. GetAllCircleIDs ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` Get all circles Ids. A short cut to get all the references for the eixisting circles GetAllMarkerID ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` Get all the existing markers's Ids GetAllPolylineIds ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` This will return a list with all available polyline id's. GetMarkers ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` Add a list of markers composed of name-value pairs. Name fields for a marker are: "lat" (type double) [required], "lng"(type double) [required], "color"(type int)[in hue value ranging from 0~360], "title"(type String), "snippet"(type String), "draggable"(type boolean) GetMyLocation ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` Get current location using Google Map Service. Return a YailList with first item beingthe latitude, the second item being the longitude, and last time being the accuracy of the reading. GetPointsFromJson ¶ Block preview not available Returns `list` Parameters Name Type json String text Convert a JsonArray of points (lat, lng pairs) to a list. MoveCamera ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type lat number lng number zoom number Move the map's camera to the specified position and zoom level RemoveCircle ¶ Block preview not available Returns `boolean` Parameters Name Type circle Id number Remove a circle for the map. Returns true if successfully removed, false if the circle does not exist with the specified id RemoveMarker ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type marker Id number Remove a marker from the map RemovePolyline ¶ Block preview not available Returns `boolean` Parameters Name Type polyline Id number Use this block to remove a polyline from the map. It will return true if it was successful. SetMapType ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type layer Name text Set the layer of Google map. Default layer is "normal", other choices including "hybrid","satellite", and "terrain" UpdateCircle ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type circle Id number property Name text value any Set the property of an existing circle. Properties include: "alpha"(number, value ranging from 0~255), "color" (nimber, hue value ranging 0~360), "radius"(number in meters) UpdateMarker ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type marker Id number property Name text value any Set the property of a marker, note that the marker has to be added first or else will throw an exception! Properties include: "color"(hue value ranging from 0~360), "title", "snippet", "draggable"(give either true or false as the value). UpdatePolyline ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type polyline Id number property Name text points any Update any polyline with the given id. You can change the property values for 'width' (in pixel), 'color' or 'points (a list of lat, lng pairs). Add Overlay ¶ Block preview not available Add overlay. Add Polygon ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type lat Min number lat Max number lon Min number lon Max number A Polygon is an enclosed shape that can be used to mark areas on the map. Add Tile Overlay ¶ Block preview not available Add title overlay. Clear All Polygons ¶ Block preview not available Clear all Polygons. Draw Central Square ¶ Block preview not available Draw central square. Get Bounding Box ¶ Block preview not available Returns `text` Parameters Name Type latitude In Degrees number longitude In Degrees number half Side In Km number Get bounding box. Get Map Center ¶ Block preview not available Returns `text` Get map center. If a error occures the output will be '-999'. Get Zoom Level Info ¶ Deprecated Block preview not available Returns `number` Deprecated block! Don't use this anymore. Use instead 'Camera Zoom Level'. Properties ¶ Camera Angle ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Move the map's camera to the specified tilt, the angle (in degrees) from the nadir (directly facing the Earth). Must be a value between 0.0 and 90.0 Camera Rotation ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Move the map's camera to the specified bearing, the direction that the camera is pointing in (in degrees clockwise from north). Camera Zoom Level ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 15 Move the map's camera to the specified zoom level. Theme ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text standard Sets the theme of the map. The choices are "standard"(default), "silver", "retro", "dark", "night", "aubergine", "vintage", "kodular" and "roads-only". Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Compass Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates whether the compass widget is currently enabled in the map ui Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Map Camera Changed Listener Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates if the map camera's position changed listener is currently enabled Map Click Listener Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates if the mapClick event listener is currently enabled Map Long Click Listener Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates if the map longClick listener is currently enabled Map Type ¶ Read-Only property Type Default text None Indicates the current map type My Location Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates whether my locaiton UI control is currently enabled for the Google map. Rotate Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates whether the capability to rotate a map on the ui is currently enabled Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Scroll Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates whether the capability to scroll a map on the ui is currently enabled Style ¶ Read-Write property Type Default text None Sets the style of the map from json. Just use a text field and paste there the json data. Create a custom map style at https://mapstyle.withgoogle.com/. Set the theme to "standard" to clear the style json. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component. Zoom Control Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates whether the zoom widget on the map ui is currently enabled Zoom Gesture Enabled ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Indicates whether the zoom gesture is currently enabled

docs.text: Google Play Games ¶ Category Version Requires Google 1 API 19 Non-visible component Overview ¶ A non-visible component that enables game user authentication, leaderboards, and more. Powered by the Google Play Games service. Events ¶ Got Player ¶ Parameters Name Type name text id text level number xp number Got player info Signed In ¶ Parameters Name Type success boolean User signed in. Signed Out ¶ User signed out. Methods ¶ GetPlayer ¶ Block preview not available Get the current player IncrementAchievement ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type achievement Id text by number Increment an achievement. IsSignedIn ¶ Block preview not available Returns `boolean` Is user signed in? ShowAchievements ¶ Block preview not available Shows Achievement. ShowLeaderboard ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type leaderboard Id text Shows Leaderboard. SignIn ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type use Last Account boolean Sign in the user. useLastAccount, true: use the last signed in account if possible, false: open a screen to choose for an account SignOut ¶ Block preview not available Sign out the user. SubmitScore ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type leaderboard Id text score number Submits user score to leaderboard. UnlockAchievement ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type achievement Id text Unlock an achievement. Properties ¶ Google Play Games App ID ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text No description available

docs.text: Youtube Player ¶ Category Version Requires Google 2 API 17 Overview ¶ A visible component that plays YouTube videos. Note: For this component to work correctly, set the MIN API to 17 (Android 4.2). Events ¶ Error ¶ Parameters Name Type error text Use this event to detect that there was any error with the player. Return values: 'UNKNOWN', 'INVALID_PARAMETER_IN_REQUEST', 'HTML_5_PLAYER', 'VIDEO_NOT_FOUND', 'VIDEO_NOT_PLAYABLE_IN_EMBEDDED_PLAYER', 'INVALID_VOLUME' or 'INVALID_SEEK_TO'. Fullscreen ¶ Parameters Name Type fullscreen boolean Event to get notified when the player enters or exits fullscreen. The variable 'fullscreen' returns true or false. Initialized ¶ Use this event to start the playing of a normal or instant youtube video. Playback Quality Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type quality text Use this event to detect that the playback quality was changed. Return values: 'UNKNOWN', 'SMALL', 'MEDIUM', 'LARGE', 'HD720', 'HD1080', 'HIGH_RES' or 'DEFAULT'. Playback Rate Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type rate text Use this event to detect that the playback rate was changed. Return values: 'UNKNOWN', 'RATE_0_25', 'RATE_0_5', 'RATE_1', 'RATE_1_5' or 'RATE_2'. State Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type state text Use this event to detect that the state changes. Return values: 'UNKNOWN', 'UNSTARTED', 'ENDED', 'PLAYING', 'PAUSED', 'BUFFERING' or 'VIDEO_CUED'. Methods ¶ EnterFullscreen ¶ Block preview not available Enter the video in fullscreen mode. ExitFullscreen ¶ Block preview not available Exit the video from fullscreen mode. GetThumbnailFromVideoId ¶ Block preview not available Returns `text` Parameters Name Type video Id text This block will return the thumbnail image path from a video id. Use only as example '_bZj-LOXdH8' from a youtube video. InstantLoad ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type video Id text Use this block together with the 'Youtube Player' Initialized event. Loads and automatically plays the specified youtube video. Use only as example '_bZj-LOXdH8' from a youtube video. Load ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type video Id text Loads the specified video's thumbnail and prepares the player to play the video. Does not automatically play the video. Use only as example '_bZj-LOXdH8' from a youtube video. Pause ¶ Block preview not available Pause the youtube video. Play ¶ Block preview not available Plays the youtube video. SeekTo ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position number Set a position where the youtube video should start playing in seconds. ToggleFullscreen ¶ Block preview not available Toggle the state of the video player. Properties ¶ Enable Live Video UI ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If you want to play live videos you must setup the UI accordingly, by calling this method. If enabled, the user can not select a second on the video progress bar. Start Second ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 The time from which the video should start playing. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Volume ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 50 Set the volume to a number between 0 and 100.Use only integer numbers. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Get Current Second ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Returns the current second. Get Video Duration ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Returns the video duration in seconds. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Is Fullscreen ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Returns true if the player is in fullscreen mode. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Test Video Id ¶ Read-Only property Type Default text None Use this block to test the youtube player. Powered by Kodular.io Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Card View ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > General 4 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that lets the user group other components as a Card. Cards are panels with a set elevation and border radius, meant to draw the user''s attention to their content. Events ¶ Click ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple "Click". Long Click ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple "Long click". Touch Down ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple touch down on the card. Touch Up ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple touch up on the card. Properties ¶ Align Horizontal ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned, 3 = horizontally centered. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic. Align Vertical ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 No description available Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the card view background color. Content Padding Bottom ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 8 Sets the bottom padding between the card view edges and the children of CardView. Content Padding Left ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 8 Sets the left padding between the card view edges and the children of card view. Content Padding Right ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 8 Sets the right padding between the card view edges and the children of card view. Content Padding Top ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 8 Sets the top padding between the card view edges and the children of card view. Corner Radius ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 2 The corner radius from the card view. Elevation ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 2 The card view elevation value. Full Clickable ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set to true, the card will consume all click events. This means if you have added as example buttons into the card, then will the card consume the touch event on the button. And this means that the button would not be clickable, but only the entire card. Stroke Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC The stroke color for the card view. Stroke Width ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 The stroke width for the card view. Touch Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC Set the touch color also known as ripple color to the card view component. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.
docs.title: Card View

docs.text: Form ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > General 42 API 19 Overview ¶ Top-level component containing all other components in the program. Events ¶ Back Pressed ¶ Device back button pressed. Error Occurred ¶ Parameters Name Type component component function Name text error Number number message text Event raised when an error occurs. Only some errors will raise this condition. For those errors, the system will show a notification by default. You can use this event handler to prescribe an error behavior different than the default. Got Received Shared ¶ Parameters Name Type type number value text Event to detect that a user shared content to your app throw the sharing dialog of any other app. Type stand for integer. 0 = nothing shared, 1 = audio, 2 = image, 3 = text or 4 = video Initialize ¶ Screen starting Keyboard Visibility Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type is Keyboard Visible boolean Event will be invoked if the keyboard was visible or invisible. Menu Initialize ¶ Event to detect when the menu has loaded. Set here your blocks like TitleBarIcon or AddMenuItem. Menu Item Selected ¶ Parameters Name Type menu Item text Event to detect when a menu item has been selected. On App Pause ¶ The system calls this method as the first indication that the user is leaving your activity (though it does not always mean the activity is being destroyed). On App Resume ¶ When the activity enters the Resumed state, it comes to the foreground, and then the system invokes this event. On App Stop ¶ When your activity is no longer visible to the user, it has entered the Stopped state, and the system invokes this event. Other Screen Closed ¶ Parameters Name Type other Screen Name text result any Event raised when another screen has closed and control has returned to this screen. Permission Denied ¶ Parameters Name Type component component function Name text permission Name text Event to handle when the app user has denied a needed permission. Permission Granted ¶ Parameters Name Type permission Name text Event to handle when the app user has granted a needed permission. This event is only run when permission isgranted in response to the AskForPermission method. Screen Orientation Changed ¶ Screen orientation changed Side Menu Closed ¶ Event will be invoked if the side menu was closed. Side Menu Opened ¶ Event will be invoked if the side menu was opened. Title Bar Icon Selected ¶ Parameters Name Type icon text name text The event returns the 'icon' or 'name' of the selected icon. Title Bar Back Button Clicked ¶ Event to detect when a menu item has been selected. Methods ¶ AddMenuItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type menu Item list Add a new item to the menu. Use the 'make a list' block. AddMenuItemWithIcon ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type menu Item text menu Icon text Add a new item with a icon on the left side to the menu. This function does not use the make a list block. If you want more items with icon then use this block again. AddTitleBarIcon ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type icon text name text Add a new action icon to the TitleBar. You will see a toast message on a long click with your choosen name. Add this block to the "MenuInitialize" event. ArePermissionsGranted ¶ Block preview not available Returns `boolean` Returns true if ALL needed app permissions were granted, else false. AskForPermission ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type permission Name text Ask the user to grant access to a dangerous permission. CanWriteSystemSettings ¶ Block preview not available Returns `boolean` Returns true if the app can write system settings, else it returns false. It will return true automatic for devices with android version below 6 (API 23). HideKeyboard ¶ Block preview not available Hide the keyboard. LockSideMenu ¶ Block preview not available Use this block to lock the side menu. This means the user can not open the side menu until the side menu unlock block is used. MoveTaskToBack ¶ Block preview not available Move task to back. That means it will minimize your current app. OpenAppSettings ¶ Block preview not available Opens the settings screen of the app. Useful if 'Are Permissions Granted' has returned false. OpenSystemWriteSettings ¶ Block preview not available Opens the app's system settings page. This works only for devices with android 6+. RemoveSideMenu ¶ Block preview not available Remove a first created side menu. This block will be usefull if you need to update a side menu dynamically. You can use this block too to test a side menu in the companion. Add then this block above of the 'Side Menu' block. RemoveTitleBarIcons ¶ Block preview not available Remove all added action icons from the TitleBar. ResetMenu ¶ Block preview not available Reset the menu back to its default ShowAboutApplication ¶ Block preview not available Show the dialog which shows when pressing the "About This Application" button in the menu. ShowKeyboard ¶ Block preview not available Show the keyboard SideMenu ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type layout component Create a Side Menu. Set to "layout" your layout that will be then your side menu. Use as example a vertical arrangement. Your choosen layout will be then removed from the screen and only visible in the side menu."Information": This block works on companion only if you add a side menu on button click.Don’t add it in companion on "screen initialize event". Else the companion will crash.Do NOT use this block with the Side Menu Layout component SideMenuClose ¶ Block preview not available If you had set your side menu then you can use this block to close it as example with a button click. SideMenuOpen ¶ Block preview not available If you had set your side menu then you can use this block to open it as example with a button click. TaskDescription ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type text text color number Sets information describing the task with this activity for presentation inside the Recents System UI. You will see the settings if the device API is >= 21 and you minimize the app. UnlockSideMenu ¶ Block preview not available Use this block to unlock the side menu. This means the user can now open again the side menu. VersionCode ¶ Block preview not available Returns `number` This block will returns the version code VersionName ¶ Block preview not available Returns `text` This block will returns the version name Properties ¶ About Screen ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Information about the screen. It appears when "About this Application" is selected from the system menu. Use it to inform people about your app. In multiple screen apps, each screen has its own AboutScreen info. About Screen Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 No description available About Screen Light Theme ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available About Screen Title ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text About this application Define the title of the about application option. Accent Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFF4081 This is the accent color used for highlights and other user interface accents. Align Horizontal ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how contents of the screen are aligned horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = horizontally centered, 3 = right aligned. Align Vertical ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom. Vertical alignment has no effect if the screen is scrollable. App ID ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The unique APP_ID for the user (which is generated by GWT and stored in Datastore) App Name ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text This is the display name of the installed application in the phone.If the AppName is blank, it will be set to the name of the project when the project is built. Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF BackgroundColor property getter method. Background Image ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The screen background image. Close Screen Animation ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text default The animation for closing current screen and returning to the previous screen. Valid options are default, fade, zoom, slidehorizontal, slidevertical, and none High Quality Images ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set to true, pictures will be loaded in high quality. Icon ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Specifies the name of the application icon. Keep Screen On ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Keep the device's screen turned on and bright. Min SDK (Min. Android Version) ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 19 No description available Navigation Bar Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Set navigation bar color. This will work starting from API Level 21 (Android Lollipop) Open Screen Animation ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text default The animation for switching to another screen. Valid options are default, fade, zoom, slidehorizontal, slidevertical, and none Package Name ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom PackageName for the app Primary Color / Title Bar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF3F51B5 This is the primary color used for Material UI elements, such as the ActionBar. Primary Color Dark / Status Bar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF303F9F This is the primary color used for darker elements in Material UI. RTL Support ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Receive Shared Files ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text No description available Screen Orientation ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text unspecified The requested screen orientation, specified as a text value. Commonly used values are landscape, portrait, sensor, user and unspecified. See the Android developer documentation for ActivityInfo.Screen_Orientation for the complete list of possible settings. Scrollable ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False When checked, there will be a vertical scrollbar on the screen, and the height of the application can exceed the physical height of the device. When unchecked, the application height is constrained to the height of the device. Show Lists As Json ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If false, lists will be converted to strings using Lisp notation, i.e., as symbols separated by spaces, e.g., (a 1 b2 (c d). If true, lists will appear as in Json or Python, e.g. ["a", 1, "b", 2, ["c", "d"]]. This property appears only in Screen 1, and the value for Screen 1 determines the behavior for all screens. The property defaults to "false" meaning that the App Inventor programmer must explicitly set it to "true" if JSON/Python syntax is desired. At some point in the future we will alter the system so that new projects are created with this property set to "true" by default. Existing projects will not be impacted. The App Inventor programmer can also set it back to "false" in newer projects if desired. Show Navigation Bar ¶ Available as Experimental Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Show/Hide Navigation Bar Show Options Menu ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True No description available Show Status Bar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True The status bar is the topmost bar on the screen. This property reports whether the status bar is visible. Sizing ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text Responsive If set to fixed, screen layouts will be created for a single fixed-size screen and autoscaled. If set to responsive, screen layouts will use the actual resolution of the device. See the documentation on responsive design in App Inventor for more information. This property appears on Screen1 only and controls the sizing for all screens in the app. Splash Enabled ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set to true the user will see a splash screen while the app is loading the content. Splash Image ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text No description available Theme ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text AppTheme Sets the theme used by the application. Title ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The caption for the form, which apears in the title bar Title Bar Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Title Bar Subtitle ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Set the TitleBar's subtitle. Title Bar Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Title Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True The title bar is the top gray bar on the screen. This property reports whether the title bar is visible. Tutorial URL ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text A URL to use to populate the Tutorial Sidebar while editing a project. Used as a teaching aid. Version Code ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 An integer value which must be incremented each time a new Android Application Package File (APK) is created for the Google Play Store. Version Name ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text 1.0 A string which can be changed to allow Google Play Store users to distinguish between different versions of the App. Drawer Arrow Icon Color ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Set the drawer arrow icon color. Height ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Screen height (y-size). Is Companion ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None This block will return true, if you are running your project current in the companion application. Else it will return false. is Side Menu Added ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Returns true if a side menu is added to the screen. is Side Menu Open ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Returns true if a side menu is current open. Else it will return false. Navigation Bar Light Icons ¶ Read-Write property Type Default boolean None This option tells the system to use dark navigation bar icons, useful for lighter colored navigation bars. Works only for devices with API >= 26. Navigation Icon Color ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Set the navigation icon color. Options Menu Icon Color ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Set the options menu icon color. Show Title Bar Back Button ¶ Read-Write property Type Default boolean None If true it will show in the TitleBar a back button only if no side menu was added. If a side menu was added it will remove the ‘hamburger’-menu icon but the side menu can still be opened. Status Bar Color ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Set status bar color. This will work starting from API Level 21 (Android Lollipop Status Bar Light Icons ¶ Read-Write property Type Default boolean None This option tells the system to use dark statusbar icons, useful for lighter colored status bars. Works only for devices with API >= 23. Title Bar Color ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Set title bar color Title Bar Text Color ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Set a custom color for the TitleBar text. Width ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Screen width (x-size). is Keyboard Visible ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Returns the status of the keyboard. If the keyboard is visible then the result is true.

docs.title: Scrollable

docs.text: Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If false, lists will be converted to strings using Lisp notation, i.e., as symbols separated by spaces, e.g., (a 1 b2 (c d). If true, lists will appear as in Json or Python, e.g. ["a", 1, "b", 2, ["c", "d"]]. This property appears only in Screen 1, and the value for Screen 1 determines the behavior for all screens. The property defaults to "false" meaning that the App Inventor programmer must explicitly set it to "true" if JSON/Python syntax is desired. At some point in the future we will alter the system so that new projects are created with this property set to "true" by default. Existing projects will not be impacted. The App Inventor programmer can also set it back to "false" in newer projects if desired.
docs.title: Show Lists As Json

docs.text: Grid View ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > General 1 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that groups other components in a two-dimensional, scrollable grid. Events ¶ After Picking ¶ Parameters Name Type item text Triggers after an item from this component has been selected Methods ¶ ClearGridView ¶ Block preview not available Clears the items from the component Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00000000 Specifies the background color. Columns ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 4 Returns number of columns for this component Elements From String ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The elements specified as a string with the items separated by commas such as: Cheese,Fruit,Bacon,Radish. Each word before the comma will be an element in the list. Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 Sets the font size of the elements Padding ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 2 The amount of padding (in DIP) on left, top, right, bottom Stretch Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Control how items are stretched to fill their space Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Specifies the checkbox's text color as an alpha-red-green-blueinteger. Thumbnail Height in DIP ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 155 Sets the thumbnail height in DIP (Density Independent Pixels) Thumbnail Width in DIP ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 155 Sets the thumbnail width in DIP (Density Independent Pixels) Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Elements ¶ Read-Write property Type Default list None List of elements to be used for GridView Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Selection ¶ Read-Write property Type Default text None Set the selection to the GridView Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Horizontal Arrangement ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > General 9 API 19 Overview ¶ A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed from left to right. If you wish to have components displayed one over another, use VerticalArrangement instead. Events ¶ Click ¶ Click listener event. Long Click ¶ Long click listener event. Properties ¶ Align Horizontal ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned, 3 = horizontally centered. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic. Align Vertical ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic. Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00000000 Returns the component's background color Clickable ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Set the component clickable or not clickable. Image ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Returns the path of the button's image. Scrollbar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Whether to display a scrollbar Use Round Card ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If enabled the card layout will have then round corners. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Is Card ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If enabled the arrangement will be convert to a card view. You can detect clicks on it with the "Click" event. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Full Clickable ¶ Deprecated Read-Write property Type Default boolean None No description available Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Horizontal Scroll Arrangement ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > General 7 API 19 Overview ¶ A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed from left to right. If you wish to have components displayed one over another, use VerticalArrangement instead. This version is scrollable. Events ¶ Click ¶ Click listener event. Long Click ¶ Long click listener event. Properties ¶ Align Horizontal ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned, 3 = horizontally centered. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic. Align Vertical ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic. Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00000000 Returns the component's background color Clickable ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Set the component clickable or not clickable. Image ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Returns the path of the button's image. Scrollbar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Whether to display a scrollbar Use Round Card ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If enabled the card layout will have then round corners. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Is Card ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If enabled the arrangement will be convert to a card view. You can detect clicks on it with the "Click" event. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Full Clickable ¶ Deprecated Read-Write property Type Default boolean None No description available Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Swipe Refresh Layout ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > General 2 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that groups other components and lets the user refresh them via a swipe-down gesture. Events ¶ On Refresh ¶ Event to detect when a refresh is triggered via the swipe gesture. Properties ¶ Align Horizontal ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned, 3 = horizontally centered. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic. Align Vertical ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic. Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00000000 The background color of the swipe refresh layout. Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set to true the swpipe refresh layout is enabled. Large Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If enabled is set to true the pull size will be large, else the size is default. Nested Scrolling ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Enable or disable nested scrolling for this view. Progress Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Change the pull to refresh background color. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Is Refreshing ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Returns true if is actively showing refresh progress. Progress Animation Colors ¶ Read-Write property Type Default list None Set the colors used in the progress animation. Use a 'make a list' block. The first color on the list is than the first spinner color. Refreshing ¶ Read-Write property Type Default boolean None Notify the widget that refresh state has changed. Do not call this when refresh is triggered by a swipe gesture. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Vertical Arrangement ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > General 9 API 19 Overview ¶ A formatting element in which to place components that should be displayed one below another. (The first child component is stored on top, the second beneath it, etc.) If you wish to have components displayed next to one another, use HorizontalArrangement instead. Properties ¶ Align Horizontal ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned, 3 = horizontally centered. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's width is automatic. Align Vertical ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 A number that encodes how the contents of the arrangement are aligned vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic. Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00000000 Returns the component's background color Clickable ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Set the component clickable or not clickable. Image ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Returns the path of the button's image. Scrollbar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Whether to display a scrollbar Use Round Card ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If enabled the card layout will have then round corners. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Is Card ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If enabled the arrangement will be convert to a card view. You can detect clicks on it with the "Click" event. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Full Clickable ¶ Deprecated Read-Write property Type Default boolean None No description available Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. docs.text: List View List View Image and Text
docs.title: Overview of Layout > Lists

docs.text: List View Image and Text ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > Lists 4 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that displays a list of elements consisting of an image and two labels. Events ¶ Click ¶ Parameters Name Type position number title text subtitle text image text Triggers when the user clicks on a item in the list Long Click ¶ Parameters Name Type position number title text subtitle text image text Triggers when the user long clicks on a item in the list Methods ¶ AddItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type image text title text subtitle text Add a item to the list AddItemFromList ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type list list Add a item to the list ClearList ¶ Block preview not available Remove all the items from the list RemoveItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position number Remove a item from the list UpdateItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position number image text title text subtitle text Update a item of the list Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00FFFFFF Set the background color of the listview Divider Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC Set the divider color of the listview Image Side ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Set the side of the image Set it to 1 for Left side and 2 for Right side Item Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Set ListItem Size Set it to 1 for Normal size, 2 for Small size and 3 for Big size. Subtitle Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Whether the subtitle should be in bold text Subtitle Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF757575 Changed the color of the subtitle text Subtitle Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Change the Typeface of the Subtitle Subtitle Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom title font. Subtitle HTML ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, then the subtitle will show html text else it will show plain text. Note: Not all HTML is supported. Subtitle Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Whether the subtitle should be in italic text Subtitle Text Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14 The text size of the subtitle. Title Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Whether the title should be in bold text Title Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF212121 Changed the color of the title text Title Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Change the Typeface of the Title Title Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom title font. Title HTML ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, then the title will show html text else it will show plain text. Note: Not all HTML is supported. Title Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Whether the title should be in italic text Title Text Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14 The text size of the title. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Determines the height of the list on the view. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Determines the width of the list on the view. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: List View ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > Lists 13 API 19 Overview ¶ This is a visible component that displays a list of text elements. The list can be set using the ElementsFromString property or using the Elements block in the blocks editor. Events ¶ After Picking ¶ Simple event to be raised after the an element has been chosen in the list. The selected element is available in the Selection property. Long Click ¶ Simple event to be raised after the an element has been chosen in the list via long click. The selected element is available in the Selection property. Methods ¶ ClearList ¶ Block preview not available Remove all the items from the list Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF607D8B The color of the listview background. Divider Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Set the divider color Divider Height ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 2 Set the divider height. Elements From String ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The ListView elements specified as a string with the items separated by commas such as: Cheese,Fruit,Bacon,Radish. Each word before the comma will be an element in the list. Filter Bar Hint ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text Search list... The hint that will be displayed in the filter bar. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. HTML Format ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true if html is enabled. Item Height in % ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 10 Set the listview item height. If you write 10, that means the item height will be 10 percent of the device screen height. Long Click Enabled ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true long click on items are enabled, else long click is disabled. Scrollbar Fading ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Return the state of ScrollbarFading. If ScrollbarFading is enabled returns true. Scrolling Speed ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1.0 The amount of friction applied to flings. Search Hint Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC The color of the search hint text. Search Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF The color of the search text. Search Text Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 The text size of the search text. Selection ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Set the selection to the ListView. Selection Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC The color of the item when it is selected. Show Filter Bar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Sets visibility of ShowFilterBar. True will show the bar, False will hide it. Show Scrollbar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Return the state of ShowScrollbar. If ShowScrollbar is enabled returns true. Show Selection Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Sets visibility of ShowSelectionColor. True will show the selection color on a selected item, False will hide it. Text Alignment ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 The text color of the listview items. Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 22 The text size of the listview items. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Elements ¶ Read-Write property Type Default list None List of text elements to show in the ListView. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Determines the height of the list on the view. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Scroll To Position ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Smoothly scroll to the specified position. The listview will scroll such that the indicated position is displayed. Selection Index ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None The index of the currently selected item, starting at 1. If no item is selected, the value will be 0. If an attempt is made to set this to a number less than 1 or greater than the number of items in the ListView, SelectionIndex will be set to 0, and Selection will be set to the empty text. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Determines the width of the list on the view. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Bottom Navigation ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > Navigation 1 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that shows a navigation menu in the bottom of the screen. Events ¶ Item Selected ¶ Parameters Name Type id number title text Event triggers when an item was selected. Methods ¶ AddItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text image text Add an item to the bottom menu RemoveAllItems ¶ Block preview not available Remove all items from the bottom menu RemoveItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number Remove an item from the bottom menu SelectItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number Select an item from the bottom menu UpdateItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text image text Update an item of the bottom menu Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Set the background color of the Bottom Navigation Menu Selected Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF3F51B5 Set the color of the selected item of the Bottom Navigation Menu Unselected Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF6E6E6E Set the color of the unselected items of the Bottom Navigation Menu Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method.

docs.text: Side Menu Layout ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > Navigation 2 API 19 Non-visible component Overview ¶ A non-visible component that creates a side menu. Side menus are navigation menus that slide from the left of the screen via a swipe-right gesture. Events ¶ On Menu Item Click ¶ Parameters Name Type title text Triggers when the user clicks on an item of the Navigation Menu Methods ¶ AddItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type title text image text enabled boolean checked boolean group number Add an item to the Navigation Menu RemoveItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type title text Remove an item from the Navigation Menu UpdateItem ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type title text new Title text image text enabled boolean checked boolean Update an item of the Navigation Menu Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Set the background color of the Sidemenu Layout Circle Header Picture ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Sets (or not) the header picture to use a circle shape Disabled Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF9E9E9E Sets the color of the disabled elements of the SideMenu Enabled Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Sets the color of the enabled elements of the SideMenu Header Background Image ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Sets the Header Background Picture Header Picture ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Sets the Header Picture of the Side Menu Header Subtitle ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Sets the Header Subtitle Header Title ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Sets the Header Title Selected Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFE81E63 Sets the color of the selected element of the SideMenu

docs.text: Tab Layout ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > Navigation 1 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that groups other layout components such that only one of its children is shown at a time. Each of the child layouts can be accessed either by swiping left and right, or using the tabs at the top. Events ¶ Tab Item Selected ¶ Parameters Name Type tab text position number The event returns the name or the position of the selected tab. Methods ¶ AddNewTab ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type name text icon text Add a new tab to the tab layout. If you don't want a icon then let it empty. AddNewTabAt ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type name text icon text position number Add a new tab to the tab layout at the given position. If you don't want a icon then let it empty. CountTabs ¶ Block preview not available Returns `number` Returns the number of current added tab's. RemoveAllTabs ¶ Block preview not available Remove all tab's from tab layout. RemoveTabAt ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position number Removes a before added tab. If you want to delete the first tab then use as position '1'. Properties ¶ Tabs Active Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFF4081 Specifies the tab's text color for active tab's. Tabs Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF3F51B5 Specifies the tab's background color. Tabs Indicator Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the tab's indicator color. Tabs Mode ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Choose the mode used for the tab's. If no mode is specified, 'Scrollable' is taken as 'Default'. Use '0' for scrollable and '1' for fixed. Tabs Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the tab's text color for not selected tab's. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Get Current Tab ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Get the current selected tab. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Select Tab ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Select a tab which is then the active tab. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: View Pager ¶ Category Version Requires Layout > Navigation 3 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that groups other layout components each of which can be accessed by swiping left or right. Events ¶ Page Selected ¶ Parameters Name Type position number Event to detect that a page was selected. Methods ¶ AddComponentToView ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type component component tab Name text Add a component to the view pager. The first added component will be the first visible component on the screen. RemoveAllTabs ¶ Block preview not available Remove all tab's from view pager. RemoveViewAt ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position number Removes a before added view from the view pager. If you want to delete the first page then use as position '1'. Properties ¶ Show Tabs ¶ Available as Experimental Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set to true, you will see tabs above the view pager. Tabs Active Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFF4081 Specifies the tab's text color for active tab's. Tabs Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF3F51B5 Specifies the tab's background color. Tabs Indicator Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the tab's indicator color. Tabs Mode ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Choose the mode used for the tab's. If no mode is specified, 'Scrollable' is taken as 'Default'. Use '0' for scrollable and '1' for fixed. Tabs Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the tab's text color for not selected tab's. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Specifies whether the component should be visible on the screen. Value is true if the component is showing and false if hidden. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Get Current Page ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Get the current selected visible page. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Select Page ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Select a page which is then the active page. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.
