docs.text: Date Picker ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 8 API 19 Overview ¶ A button that, when clicked on, launches a popup dialog to allow the user to select a date. Events ¶ After Date Set ¶ Event that runs after the user chooses a Date in the dialog Got Focus ¶ Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it. Lost Focus ¶ Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it. Touch Down ¶ Indicates that the button was pressed down. Touch Up ¶ Indicates that a button has been released. Methods ¶ AnimationStyle ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type style text position text size number color number Allows you to set animation style. Valid (case-insensitive) values are: ChasingDots, Circle, CubeGrid, DoubleBounce, FadingCircle, FoldingCube, Pulse, RotatingCircle, RotatingPlane, ThreeBounce, WanderingCubes, Wave. If invalid style is used, animation will be removed.Position can be: top, left, right, bottom. Size can be 100. ButtonClick ¶ Block preview not available Perform a button click as function. LaunchPicker ¶ Block preview not available Launches the DatePicker popup. SetDateToDisplay ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type year number month number day number Allows the user to set the date to be displayed when the date picker opens Valid values for the month field are 1-12 and 1-31 for the day field. SetDateToDisplayFromInstant ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type instant InstantInTime Allows the user to set the date from the instant to be displayed when the date picker opens. SetShadow ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type x number y number radius number color number Place a blurred shadow of text underneath the text, drawn with the specified x, y, radius, color (e.g. -11, 12, 13, black. WithIconFromFontAwesome ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position text icon Name text icon Color number padding number size number Show an image on the given position near to the button. You can use following words for the position: 'Left', 'Right', 'Top' or 'Bottom'. Use the padding to add space between the icon and text. Use a material icon as the button icon without uploading a image resource into your project. You can find the icon name (or code) here at https://fontawesome.com/cheatsheet Use as example for a heart icon just 'f004'. WithIconFromMaterialFont ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position text icon Name text icon Color number padding number size number Show an image on the given position near to the button. You can use following words for the position: 'Left', 'Right', 'Top' or 'Bottom'. Use the padding to add space between the icon and text. Use a material icon as the button icon without uploading a image resource into your project. You can find the icon name (or code) here at https://material.io/icons WithIconFromPicture ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position text picture text padding number width number height number Show an image on the given position near to the button. You can use following words for the position: 'Left', 'Right', 'Top' or 'Bottom'. Use the padding to add space between the icon and text. Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 Returns the button's background color Border Shadow ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true if the button have a outside border shadow on click. Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set, user can tap check box to cause action. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set, button text is displayed in bold. Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set, button text is displayed in italics. Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 Point size for button text. Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Font family for button text. Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. HTML Format ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, then this button will show html text else it will show plain text. Note: Not all HTML is supported. Image ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Image to display on button. Rotation Angle ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0.0 Sets the degrees that the button is rotated around the pivot point. Increasing values result in clockwise rotation. Shape ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed. Show Feedback ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown for a button that as an image as background. Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Text to display on button. Text Alignment ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Left, center, or right. Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Color for button text. Touch Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC Set the buttons touch color. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Day ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None the Day of the month that was last picked using the DatePicker. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Instant ¶ Read-Only property Type Default InstantInTime None the instant of the date that was last picked using the DatePicker. Month ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None the number of the Month that was last picked using the DatePicker. Note that months start in 1 = January, 12 = December. Month In Text ¶ Read-Only property Type Default text None Returns the name of the Month that was last picked using the DatePicker, in textual format. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component. Year ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None the Year that was last picked using the DatePicker

docs.text: Floating Action Button ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 2 API 19 Non-visible component Overview ¶ A non-visible component that is used to create Floating Action Buttons. Floating Action Buttons are used to indicate the primary action of the screen. Events ¶ Click ¶ Event to detect that the fab button was clicked. Long Click ¶ Event to detect that the fab button was long clicked. Methods ¶ Hide ¶ Block preview not available Hides the fab button. HideTextMessage ¶ Block preview not available Hides text message. Show ¶ Block preview not available Shows the fab button. ShowTextMessage ¶ Block preview not available Show a new text message near to the fab with the given properties. You can do the changes with the properties in the advanded category. StartRotationAnimation ¶ Block preview not available Starts a rotation animation. You can use the 'Rotation Duration','Rotation Start Degrees' and 'Rotation End Degrees' to define the animation. This block will work too if the 'Rotation On Click' property is disabled. Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF2196F2 Returns the fab's background color. Call Fab Click Event When Label Clicked ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true the FAB click listener will be invoked on a text message click. Call Fab Long Click Event When Label Long Clicked ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true the FAB long click listener will be invoked on a text message long click. Elevation ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 10 No description available Hide Label When Clicked ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Hide the text message when clicking on the message Hide Label When Long Clicked ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Hide the text message after a long click on the text message. Icon ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The path for the used image in FAB. Icon Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF The color for the material icon. Material Icon Name ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text add Use a material icon for the fab without uploading a image resource into your project. You can find the icon name (or code) here at https://material.io/icons Margin Bottom ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 16 Returns the fab's bottom margin. Margin Right ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 16 Returns right margin Ripple Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Returns the fab's ripple color. Rotation Duration (millisecond) ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 300 Returns the fab's rotation duration in milliseconds. Rotation End Degrees ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 360 Returns the fab's rotation end degrees. Rotate On Click ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true if the fab will rotate on click. Rotation Start Degrees ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Returns the fab's rotation start degrees. Show Label On Left Side ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Set the text message to the left side of the floating button. If false the text will be on the right side. Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Sets the size of the button. Use '1' for normal, '2' for mini or '3' for auto size based on the screen size. Label Background Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 Set the text message background color. Label Corner Radius ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 8 Set the text message corner radius. Label Text ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set the text message. Label Text Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Set the text message color. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true if the fab button is visible.
docs.title: Floating Action Button

docs.text: Image ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 5 API 19 Overview ¶ Component for displaying images. The picture to display, and other aspects of the Image's appearance, can be specified in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor. You can also add gif images. Events ¶ Click ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple "Click". Long Click ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple "Long Click". Methods ¶ ClearImageTintColor ¶ Block preview not available Clear the image tint color. Properties ¶ Clickable ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Set the component clickable or not clickable. Picture ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text No description available Rotation Angle ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0.0 The angle at which the image picture appears rotated. This rotation does not appear on the designer screen, only on the device. Scale Picture To Fit ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Specifies whether the image should be resized to match the size of the ImageView. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Animation ¶ Read-Write property Type Default text None This is a limited form of animation that can attach a small number of motion types to images. The allowable motions are ScrollRightSlow, ScrollRight, ScrollRightFast, ScrollLeftSlow, ScrollLeft, ScrollLeftFast, and Stop Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Image Tint Color ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Change the image tint color. You can use too alpha values if you want with the 'make a list' block. Do not forget to use the 'make color' block together with the 'make a list' block. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Scaling ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None This property determines how the picture scales according to the Height or Width of the Image. Scale proportionally (0) preserves the picture aspect ratio. Scale to fit (1) matches the Image area, even if the aspect ratio changes. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Label ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 9 API 19 Overview ¶ A Label displays a piece of text, which is specified through the Text property. Other properties, all of which can be set in the Designer or Blocks Editor, control the appearance and placement of the text. Events ¶ Click ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple "Click". Long Click ¶ Event to detect that a user has done a simple "Long Click". Methods ¶ AnimationStyle ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type style text position text size number color number Allows you to set animation style. Valid (case-insensitive) values are: ChasingDots, Circle, CubeGrid, DoubleBounce, FadingCircle, FoldingCube, Pulse, RotatingCircle, RotatingPlane, ThreeBounce, WanderingCubes, Wave. If invalid style is used, animation will be removed.Position can be: top, left, right, bottom. Size can be 100. SetShadow ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type x number y number radius number color number Place a blurred shadow of text underneath the text, drawn with the specified x, y, radius, color (e.g. -11, 12, 13, black Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00FFFFFF No description available Clickable ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Set the component clickable or not clickable. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 No description available Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. HTML Format ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, then this label will show html text else it will show plain text. Note: Not all HTML is supported. Has Margins ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Reports whether or not the label appears with margins. All four margins (left, right, top, bottom) are the same. This property has no effect in the designer, where labels are always shown with margins. Marquee ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean false No description available Rotation Angle ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0.0 Sets the degrees that the label is rotated around the pivot point. Increasing values result in clockwise rotation. Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text No description available Text Alignment ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 No description available Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Linear Progressbar ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 1 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that indicates the progress of an operation using an animated linear bar. Events ¶ Progress Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type progress number Event that indicates that the progress of the progress bar has been changed. Returns the current progress value. If "Indeterminate" is set to true, then it returns "0". Methods ¶ IncrementProgressBy ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type value number Increase the progress bar's progress by the specified amount. Properties ¶ Indeterminate ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Change the indeterminate mode for this progress bar. In indeterminate mode, the progress is ignored and the progress bar shows an infinite animation instead. Indeterminate Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF2196F2 Change the indeterminate color of the progress bar. Maximum ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 100 Set the upper range of the progress bar max. Minimum ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Set the lower range of the progress bar to min. This function works only for devices with API >= 26 Progress Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF2196F2 Change the progress color of the progress bar. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Progress ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Sets the current progress to the specified value. Does not do anything if the progress bar is in indeterminate mode. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: List Picker ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 17 API 19 Overview ¶ A button that, when clicked on, displays a list of texts for the user to choose among. The texts can be specified through the Designer or Blocks Editor by setting the ElementsFromString property to their string-separated concatenation (for example, choice 1, choice 2, choice 3 ) or by setting the Elements property to a List in the Blocks editor. Setting property ShowFilterBar to true, will make the list searchable. Other properties affect the appearance of the button ( TextAlignment , BackgroundColor , etc.) and whether it can be clicked on ( Enabled ). Events ¶ After Picking ¶ Parameters Name Type selection text Event to be raised after the picker activity returns itsresult and the properties have been filled in. Before Picking ¶ Event to raise when the button of the component is clicked or the list is shownusing the Open block. This event occurs before the list of items is displayed, andcan be used to prepare the list before it is shown. Got Focus ¶ Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it. Lost Focus ¶ Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it. Touch Down ¶ Indicates that the button was pressed down. Touch Up ¶ Indicates that a button has been released. Methods ¶ AnimationStyle ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type style text position text size number color number Allows you to set animation style. Valid (case-insensitive) values are: ChasingDots, Circle, CubeGrid, DoubleBounce, FadingCircle, FoldingCube, Pulse, RotatingCircle, RotatingPlane, ThreeBounce, WanderingCubes, Wave. If invalid style is used, animation will be removed.Position can be: top, left, right, bottom. Size can be 100. ButtonClick ¶ Block preview not available Perform a button click as function. Open ¶ Block preview not available Opens the picker, as though the user clicked on it. SetShadow ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type x number y number radius number color number Place a blurred shadow of text underneath the text, drawn with the specified x, y, radius, color (e.g. -11, 12, 13, black. WithIconFromFontAwesome ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position text icon Name text icon Color number padding number size number Show an image on the given position near to the button. You can use following words for the position: 'Left', 'Right', 'Top' or 'Bottom'. Use the padding to add space between the icon and text. Use a material icon as the button icon without uploading a image resource into your project. You can find the icon name (or code) here at https://fontawesome.com/cheatsheet Use as example for a heart icon just 'f004'. WithIconFromMaterialFont ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position text icon Name text icon Color number padding number size number Show an image on the given position near to the button. You can use following words for the position: 'Left', 'Right', 'Top' or 'Bottom'. Use the padding to add space between the icon and text. Use a material icon as the button icon without uploading a image resource into your project. You can find the icon name (or code) here at https://material.io/icons WithIconFromPicture ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position text picture text padding number width number height number Show an image on the given position near to the button. You can use following words for the position: 'Left', 'Right', 'Top' or 'Bottom'. Use the padding to add space between the icon and text. Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 Returns the button's background color Border Shadow ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true if the button have a outside border shadow on click. Elements From String ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text ElementsFromString property setter method Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set, user can tap check box to cause action. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set, button text is displayed in bold. Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set, button text is displayed in italics. Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 Point size for button text. Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Font family for button text. Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. HTML Format ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, then this button will show html text else it will show plain text. Note: Not all HTML is supported. Image ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Image to display on button. Item Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 The background color of the ListPicker items. Item Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF The text color of the ListPicker items. Rotation Angle ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0.0 Sets the degrees that the button is rotated around the pivot point. Increasing values result in clockwise rotation. Selection ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The selected item. When directly changed by the programmer, the SelectionIndex property is also changed to the first item in the ListPicker with the given value. If the value does not appear, SelectionIndex will be set to 0. Shape ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Specifies the button's shape (default, rounded, rectangular, oval). The shape will not be visible if an Image is being displayed. Show Feedback ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown for a button that as an image as background. Show Filter Bar ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Returns current state of ShowFilterBar indicating if Search Filter Bar will be displayed on ListPicker or not Status Bar Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF2196F2 The StatusBarColor of the ListPicker. Status Bar Visible ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Whether to show status bar Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Text to display on button. Text Alignment ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Left, center, or right. Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Color for button text. Title ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Optional title displayed at the top of the list of choices. Title Bar Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF03A9F3 The TitleBarColor of the ListPicker. Title Visible ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Whether to show title bar Touch Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC Set the buttons touch color. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Elements ¶ Read-Write property Type Default list None Elements property getter method Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Selection Index ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None The index of the currently selected item, starting at 1. If no item is selected, the value will be 0. If an attempt is made to set this to a number less than 1 or greater than the number of items in the ListPicker, SelectionIndex will be set to 0, and Selection will be set to the empty text. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text:
Notifier ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 11 API 19 Non-visible component Overview ¶ The Notifier component displays alert dialogs, messages, and temporary alerts, and creates Android log entries through the following methods: ShowMessageDialog: displays a message which the user must dismiss by pressing a button. ShowChooseDialog: displays a message two buttons to let the user choose one of two responses, for example, yes or no, after which the AfterChoosing event is raised. ShowTextDialog: lets the user enter text in response to the message, after which the AfterTextInput event is raised. ShowPasswordDialog: lets the user enter password in response to the message, after which the AfterTextInput event is raised. ShowAlert: displays a temporary alert that goes away by itself after a short time. ShowProgressDialog: displays an alert with a loading spinner that cannot be dismissed by the user. It can only be dismissed by using the DismissProgressDialog block. CustomMessageDialog: New version to display dialogs with icon and in fullscreen mode. CustomChooseDialog: New version to display choose dialogs with icon and in fullscreen mode. LightTheme: To display the dialogs in a light or dark theme. ShowLightbox: Displays a png or gif file from assets or from web url in a dialog. ShowLinearProgress: Shows a progress dialog with a horizontal progress bar. ShowSpinningProgress: Shows a spinning progress dialog. UpdateProgress: Change the current value of the linear progress dialog. ShowRadioListDialog: Shows a radio list dialog with a list of options. ShowCheckboxListDialog: Shows a picker dialog with a list of options. ShowListPicker: Shows a list picker dialog. ShowTextInputDialog: Show a text input dialog. ShowImageDialog: Show a image dialog. Animation types like "*.gif" are not supported. ShowNumberPicker: Shows a number picker dialog that enables the user to select a number from a predefined range. ShowWordPicker: Shows a word picker dialog that enables the user to select a number from a predefined word. DismissProgressDialog: Dismisses the progress dialog displayed by ShowProgressDialog. DismissSpinningProgress: Dismisses the progress dialog displayed by ShowSpinningProgress. DismissLinearProgress: Dismisses the progress dialog displayed by ShowLinearProgress. LogError: logs an error message to the Android log. LogInfo: logs an info message to the Android log. LogWarning: logs a warning message to the Android log. The messages in the dialogs can be formatted using the following HTML tags:, ,
,
, , ,
, , , , , , . You can also use the font tag to specify color, for example, . Some of the available color names are aqua, black, blue, fuchsia, green, grey, lime, maroon, navy, olive, purple, red, silver, teal, white, and yellow Events ¶ After Choosing ¶ Parameters Name Type choice text Event to detect that a user have done his selection. After Message Dialog ¶ Parameters Name Type title text Event to detect that a user clicked on a button from the "Show Custom Message Dialog". Use the "title" response to know which dialog the user has clicked. After Text Input ¶ Parameters Name Type response text Event to detect that a user have done his text input in the "Show Text Dialog". Checkbox Selection ¶ Parameters Name Type id number selection list Invoked after user has finished selecting items from the Checkbox picker. Returns a list of indices of the selected items in the order of selection. Returns a list having -1 if cancel was pressed. Custom Dialog Selection ¶ Parameters Name Type selection text Event to detect that the user has pressed a button from the custom dialog. It returns then the text of the button that was pressed. Got Custom Choose Dialog ¶ Parameters Name Type id number choice text Event to detect that a user have done his selection in the CustomChooseDialog. Got Text Input From Dialog ¶ Parameters Name Type id number response text Event to detect that a user have done his text input in the "Show Text Input Dialog". Image Dialog Closed ¶ Parameters Name Type id number Event to detect that the user has watched the image dialog. Lightbox Closed ¶ Parameters Name Type id number Event to detect that a user have closed the Lightbox. Linear Progress Dismissed ¶ Event to detect that the linear progress dialog was dismissed. List Picker Selection ¶ Parameters Name Type id number item text Event to get the picked list selection from the List Picker. Number Picker Selection ¶ Parameters Name Type id number selection number Event to detect that the user has selected a number from the number picker dialog. Radio Selection ¶ Parameters Name Type id number list Index number Event invoked when user has selected an option from the radio button picker. Outputs the index of the selected item. Returns -1 if cancel was pressed. Word Picker Selection ¶ Parameters Name Type id number selection text Event to detect that the user has selected a word from the word picker dialog. Methods ¶ CreateCustomDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type component component title text button Text text cancel Button Text text cancelable boolean Show whatever you want in a dialog. You can use as example arrangements, or images or whatever you want. Your chosen layout will be then removed from the screen and only visible in custom dialog. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. Please make sure the layout you want to use is visible. CustomChooseDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number message text title text button1 Text text button2 Text text cancel Button Text text icon text cancelable boolean fullscreen boolean Shows a dialog box with two buttons, from which the user can choose. If cancelable is true there will be an additional CANCEL button. Pressing a button will raise the GotCustomChooseDialog event. The "choice" parameter to GotCustomChooseDialog will be the text on the button that was pressed, or "Cancel" if the CANCEL button was pressed. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. Use the 'Show Custom Dialog' block to the show the created custom dialog. The added component must be visible on screen. After you used this block here it will be removed automatic from screen and will be only visible again after you have shown the custom dialog. CustomMessageDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text button Text text icon text fullscreen boolean Show a Message Dialog. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. DismissCustomDialog ¶ Block preview not available Use this block to dismiss the created custom dialog.the custom dialog. DismissLinearProgress ¶ Block preview not available Dismiss a previously displayed LinearProgress box DismissProgressDialog ¶ Block preview not available Dismiss a previously displayed ProgressDialog box DismissSpinningProgress ¶ Block preview not available Dismiss a previously displayed SpinningProgress box LogError ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text Writes an error message to the Android system log. See the Google Android documentation for how to access the log. LogInfo ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text Writes an information message to the Android log. LogWarning ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text Writes a warning message to the Android log. See the Google Android documentation for how to access the log. ShowAlert ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type notice text Show a alert "toast" message. ShowCheckboxListDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text options list button Text text cancel Button Text text cancelable boolean icon text fullscreen boolean Shows a picker dialog with a list of options of whichmore than one can be chosen. Invokes the 'AfterMultiSelection' event. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowChooseDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text button1 Text text button2 Text text cancelable boolean Shows a dialog box with two buttons, from which the user can choose. If cancelable is true there will be an additional CANCEL button. Pressing a button will raise the AfterChoosing event. The "choice" parameter to AfterChoosing will be the text on the button that was pressed, or "Cancel" if the CANCEL button was pressed. ShowCustomDialog ¶ Block preview not available Show the custom dialog. Dont forget that you have first to create the custom dialog. ShowImageDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text image text button Text text Show a image dialog. Animation types like "*.gif" are not supported. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowLightbox ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number image text Displays a lightbox. You can use images like " .png" or " ,gif" from assets folder or from a web url. ShowLinearProgress ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text cancelable boolean indeterminate boolean max Value number icon text Shows a progress dialog with a horizontal progress bar. Can be dismissed by user if 'cancelable' is set to true. If indeterminate is true, maxValue and the 'UpdateProgress' method will have no effect. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowListPicker ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text items List list icon text fullscreen boolean Shows a list picker dialog. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowMessageDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text button Text text Show a Message Dialog. ShowNumberPicker ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text button Text text cancel Button Text text min Value number max Value number start Value number Shows a number picker dialog that enables the user to select a number from a predefined range. You can use the "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowPasswordDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text cancelable boolean Shows a dialog box where the user can enter password (input is masked), after which the AfterTextInput event will be raised. If cancelable is true there will be an additional CANCEL button. Entering password will raise the AfterTextInput event. The "response" parameter to AfterTextInput will be the entered password, or "Cancel" if CANCEL button was pressed. ShowProgressDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text Shows a dialog box with an optional title and message (use empty strings if they are not wanted). This dialog box contains a spinning artifact to indicate that the program is working. It cannot be canceled by the user but must be dismissed by the App Inventor Program by using the DismissProgressDialog block. ShowRadioListDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text options list choose Button Text text cancelable boolean cancel Button Text text selection number icon text fullscreen boolean Shows a radio list dialog with a list of options of which only one can be chosen. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowSpinningProgress ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text cancelable boolean icon text Shows a spinning progress dialog which can be dismissed by the user if 'cancelable' is set to true. You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowTextDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text title text cancelable boolean Shows a dialog box where the user can enter text, after which the AfterTextInput event will be raised. If cancelable is true there will be an additional CANCEL button. Entering text will raise the AfterTextInput event. The "response" parameter to AfterTextInput will be the text that was entered, or "Cancel" if the CANCEL button was pressed. ShowTextInputDialog ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text default Text text icon text hint text fullscreen boolean cancelable boolean input Type number button Text text cancel Button Text text text Color number hint Color number Show a text input dialog. Possible input types are: "1= Normal text", "2= Password text", "3= Person name", "4= Email adress", "5|6= Number", "7= Password number" or "8= datetime". You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. ShowWordPicker ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type id number title text button Text text cancel Button Text text items List list Shows a word picker dialog that enables the user to select a number from a predefined word. You can use the "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color. UpdateProgress ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type value number Change the current value of the linear progress dialog. Has no effect if "indeterminate" is set to true. Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 Specifies the background color for alerts (not dialogs). Dim Amount ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0.5 Set the amount of dim behind the dialog window. Use '0.0' for no dim and '1.0' for full dim. Light Theme ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Gets the current theme Linkify ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set to true will attempt to make text clickable where possible; e.g. hyperlinks, phone numbers. Can not be used for Progress Dialogs. Notifier Length ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 specifies the length of time that the alert is shown -- either "short" or "long". Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the text color for alerts or for dialogs message. Text Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Text Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Title Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the title text color for dialogs. Title Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Title Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Use Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If enabled the dialog will use the color from the "Background Color"-option. Else it will use the theme (light or dark).
docs.title: Notifier

Possible input types are: "1= Normal text", "2= Password text", "3= Person name", "4= Email adress", "5|6= Number", "7= Password number" or "8= datetime". You can use the "Light Theme" property to have a light or dark background. Or you enable "Use Background Color" property to use the background color property as background dialog color.

docs.text: Radio Button ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 2 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that lets the user toggle between two states — checked and unchecked. Only one Radio Button in a group of Radio Buttons can be checked at any given time. Events ¶ Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type checked boolean Event invoked when the radio button state has been changed. Methods ¶ Toggle ¶ Block preview not available Change the checked state of the view to the inverse of its current state Properties ¶ Checked ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Set the radio button to checked or unchecked Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set, user can touch the radio button. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Radio Button Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Change the radio button component color. Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text Radio Button Text Set here the radio button text. Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Set the text color for the radio button. Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 The text size of the radio button. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component. is Checked ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Returns true if the radio button is checked, else false.

docs.text: Slider ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 5 API 19 Overview ¶ A Slider is a progress bar that adds a draggable thumb. You can touch the thumb and drag left or right to set the slider thumb position. As the Slider thumb is dragged, it will trigger the PositionChanged event, reporting the position of the Slider thumb. The reported position of the Slider thumb can be used to dynamically update another component attribute, such as the font size of a TextBox or the radius of a Ball. Events ¶ Position Changed ¶ Parameters Name Type thumb Position number Indicates that position of the slider thumb has changed. Touch Down ¶ Event will be invoked on a touch down. Touch Up ¶ Event will be invoked on a touch up. Properties ¶ Color Left ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF00BCD3 The color of slider to the left of the thumb. Color Right ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF9E9E9E The color of slider to the left of the thumb. Max Value ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 50.0 Sets the maximum value of slider. Changing the maximum value also resets Thumbposition to be halfway between the minimum and the (new) maximum. If the new maximum is less than the current minimum, then minimum and maximum will both be set to this value. Setting MaxValue resets the thumb position to halfway between MinValue and MaxValue and signals the PositionChanged event. Min Value ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 10.0 Sets the minimum value of slider. Changing the minimum value also resets Thumbposition to be halfway between the (new) minimum and the maximum. If the new minimum is greater than the current maximum, then minimum and maximum will both be set to this value. Setting MinValue resets the thumb position to halfway between MinValue and MaxValue and signals the PositionChanged event. Rotation Angle ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0.0 Sets the degrees that the slider is rotated around the pivot point. Increasing values result in clockwise rotation. Thumb Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF00BCD3 The color of slider thumb. This block works only on devices with api >= 16. Thumb Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Sets whether or not to display the slider thumb. Thumb Image ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text No description available Thumb Position ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 30.0 Sets the position of the slider thumb. If this value is greater than MaxValue, then it will be set to same value as MaxValue. If this value is less than MinValue, then it will be set to same value as MinValue. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Snackbar ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 4 API 19 Non-visible component Overview ¶ A non-visible component that displays an alert at the bottom of the screen. Events ¶ Click ¶ User clicked on the action button. On Dismissed ¶ Parameters Name Type event text Event to detect the snackbar was dismissed. Possible results can be: "UNDEFINED", "ACTION", "CONSECUTIVE", "MANUAL", "SWIPE" or "TIMEOUT". You can find more information at: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/design/widget/Snackbar.Callback.html On Shown ¶ Event to detect the snackbar is shown. Methods ¶ Dismiss ¶ Block preview not available Dismiss the snackbar. IsShown ¶ Block preview not available Returns `boolean` Returns true whether this snackbar is currently being shown. Show ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text Show Snackbar (message supports HTML formatting) ShowWithButton ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type message text button Text text Show Snackbar with action button (message supports HTML formatting) Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 Specifies the snackbar's background color. Button Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Specifies the action button's text color. Duration ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Specifies the length of time that the Snackbar is shown Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF No description available

docs.text: Spinner ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 3 API 19 Overview ¶ A spinner component that displays a pop-up with a list of elements. These elements can be set in the Designer or Blocks Editor by setting the ElementsFromString property to a string-separated concatenation (for example, choice 1, choice 2, choice 3 ) or by setting the Elements property to a List in the Blocks editor. Spinners are created with the first item already selected. So selecting it does not generate an After Picking event. Consequently it's useful to make the first Spinner item be a non-choice like "Select from below...". Events ¶ After Selecting ¶ Parameters Name Type selection text Event called after the user selects an item from the dropdown list. Methods ¶ DisplayDropdown ¶ Block preview not available displays the dropdown list for selection, same action as when the user clicks on the spinner. Properties ¶ Elements From String ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text Item1, Item2, Item3 Sets the Spinner list to the elements passed in the comma-separated string. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Item Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF03A9F3 Set the background color for the spinner items. Item Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Set the text color for the spinner items. Prompt ¶ Deprecated Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Text with the current title for the Spinner window. Prompt Item Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFCCCCCC Set the text color for the spinner items prompt/hint. Selection ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Returns the current selected item in the spinner. Spinner Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF2196F2 Set the text color for the spinner. Spinner Text Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 The size of the spinner selected text. Text Alignment ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 18 The text size of the spinner items. Use Prompt ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true the first spinner item will be the prompt text. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Elements ¶ Read-Write property Type Default list None returns a list of text elements to be picked from. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Selection Index ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None The index of the currently selected item, starting at 1. If no item is selected, the value will be 0. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Spotlight ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 2 API 19 Non-visible component Overview ¶ A non-visible component that brings emphasis to the specified component by means of darkening the screen around that component. Events ¶ Clicked ¶ Event triggered when the spotlight is clicked. Methods ¶ ShowSpotlight ¶ Block preview not available Use this block to show the spotlight. ShowSpotlightOnFAB ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type floating Action Button component Use this block to show the spotlight on a floating action button. Properties ¶ Circle Padding ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 20 The padding for the circle spotlight. Default is '20'. Component ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type component The component to show in the spotlight. Dismiss On Back Press ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Dismiss the spotlight on back pressed. Dismiss On Touch ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Dismiss the spotlight on touch Enable Dismiss After Shown ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Dismiss spotlight on touch after spotlight is completely visible. Enable Reveal Animation ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Enable reveal animation (Only for Lollipop and above). Fadein Text Duration ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 400 Fade in animation duration for spotlight text (Heading and Sub-heading). Font Heading Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Heading Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Font Subheading Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Subheading Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Heading Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The Spotlight heading text. Heading Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF3F51B5 The Spotlight heading text color. Heading Text Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 32 The Spotlight heading size. Intro Animation Duration ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 400 Intro animation duration (For Reveal and Fadein). Line And Arc Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF3F51B5 The Spotlight line and arc color. Line Animation Duration ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 400 Line animation duration Mask Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &Hbe000000 The Spotlight mask color Show Target Arc ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set to true you will see a half round circle below the spotlight circle. Subheading Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text The Spotlight subheading text. Subheading Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF The Spotlight subheading text color. Subheading Text Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 16 The Spotlight subheading text size.
docs.title: Spotlight

docs.text: State Progress Bar ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 1 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that indicates the progress of an operation by highlighting the steps involved in that operation. Events ¶ Error Occurred ¶ Parameters Name Type error Message text Event invoked when a error occurred. State Item Click ¶ Parameters Name Type state Number number is Current State boolean Event invoked when a state item was clicked. Properties ¶ Animation Duration ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 250 Set the animation duration in milliseconds. Example: use 1000 for 1 second. Animate Between States ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set to true the states will use a animation when they changed. Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 Change the background color. Current State Description Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF4CAF50 Change the current state description color. Current State Number ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 Set the current state number. Description Lines Spacing ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 5.0 Set the description lines spacing. Description Top Space Incrementer ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 10.0 Set the description top space incrementer. Elements From String ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text Item 1, Item 2, Item 3, Item 4, Item 5 The State Progress Bar elements specified as a string with the items separated by commas such as: Item 1, Item 2, Item 3, Item 4, Item 5. Each word before the comma will be an element in the list. You can add maximum 5 items. Foreground Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF4CAF50 Change the foreground color. Justify Multiline Description ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set to true justify multiline description is enabled. Max Description Line ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 2 Set the maximum description line. Max State Number ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 5 Set the maximum state number. State Description Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF444444 Change the state description color. State Description Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 18.0 Set the state description size. State Description Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available State Description Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font for state description typeface. State Line Thickness ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 10.0 Set the state line thickness. State Number Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Change the state number background color. State Number Foreground Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFFFFFFFF Change the state number foreground color. State Number Is Descending ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If set to true the state number is in descending order. State Number Text Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 20.0 Set the state number text size. State Number Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available State Number Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font for state number typeface. State Progress Bar Height ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 40.0 Set the state progress bar height. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. All States Completed ¶ Read-Write property Type Default boolean None If set to true all states are completed. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.

docs.text: Switch ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 4 API 19 Overview ¶ A visible component that lets the user toggle between two states — on and off. Events ¶ Clicked ¶ Parameters Name Type is Checked boolean Event invoked when a switch has been clicked. Returns true or false if the switch is checked or not. Methods ¶ ThumbImage ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type image text Set the drawable used for the switch 'thumb' - the piece that the user can physically touch and drag along the track. If 'color Filter Enabled' is set to true, the image will get a light tint filter with the same color that you used as thumb color. ThumbImageFromMaterialFont ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type icon Name text size number Set the drawable used for the switch 'thumb' - the piece that the user can physically touch and drag along the track. You can find the icon name (or code) here at https://material.io/icons . Use as size as example '300'. Properties ¶ Checked ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Set the toggle to checked or unchecked Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True If set to true, user can touch the switch. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False No description available Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 No description available Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF4CAF50 Set the text color for the switch. Text Off ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text Switch Off Set here the switch off text. HTML tags are too possible: , , , , , , , , , , , , , . Example: Test . Text On ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default text Switch On Set here the switch on text. HTML tags are too possible: , , , , , , , , , , , , , . Example: Test . Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 The text size of the switch. Thumb Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF4CAF50 Change the disabled color of the switch. Track Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF009688 Change the enabled color of the switch. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component. is Checked ¶ Read-Only property Type Default boolean None Return true if the switch is checked else false.

docs.text: Text Box ¶ Category Version Requires User Interface 13 API 19 Overview ¶ A box for the user to enter text. The initial or user-entered text value is in the Text property. If blank, the Hint property, which appears as faint text in the box, can provide the user with guidance as to what to type. The MultiLine property determines if the text can havemore than one line. For a single line text box, the keyboard will closeautomatically when the user presses the Done key. To close the keyboard for multiline text boxes, the app should use the HideKeyboard method or rely on the user to press the Back key. The NumbersOnly property restricts the keyboard to acceptnumeric input only. Other properties affect the appearance of the text box ( TextAlignment , BackgroundColor , etc.) and whether it can be used ( Enabled ). Text boxes are usually used with the Button component, with the user clicking on the button when text entry is complete. If the text entered by the user should not be displayed, use PasswordTextBox instead. Events ¶ Got Focus ¶ Event raised when this component is selected for input, such as bythe user touching it. Lost Focus ¶ Event raised when this component is no longer selected for input, suchas if the user touches a different text box. On Text Changed ¶ Event to detect text changes. Methods ¶ AnimationStyle ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type style text position text size number color number Allows you to set animation style. Valid (case-insensitive) values are: ChasingDots, Circle, CubeGrid, DoubleBounce, FadingCircle, FoldingCube, Pulse, RotatingCircle, RotatingPlane, ThreeBounce, WanderingCubes, Wave. If invalid style is used, animation will be removed.Position can be: top, left, right, bottom. Size can be 100. HideKeyboard ¶ Block preview not available Hide the keyboard. Only multiline text boxes need this. Single line text boxes close the keyboard when the users presses the Done key. RequestFocus ¶ Block preview not available Sets the textbox active. SetCursorAt ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type position number Set the cursor to the given position. SetCursorAtEnd ¶ Block preview not available Set the cursor to the end of the text. SetShadow ¶ Block preview not available Parameters Name Type x number y number radius number color number Place a blurred shadow of text underneath the text, drawn with the specified x, y, radius, color (e.g. -11, 12, 13, black ShowError ¶ Block preview not available Shows an error message next to the textbox. Properties ¶ Background Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00000000 The background color of the input box. You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor. The default background color is 'default' (shaded 3-D look). Cursor Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 The color of the cursor. Cursor Visible ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Makes the cursor visible (the default) or invisible. Enabled ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Whether the user can enter text into this input box. By default, this is true. Error Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Returns the error text. Font Bold ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Whether the font for the text should be bold. By default, it is not. Font Italic ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Whether the text should appear in italics. By default, it does not. Font Size ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 14.0 The font size for the text. By default, it is 14.0 points. Font Typeface ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 The font for the text. The value can be changed in the Designer. Font Typeface Import ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type text Set a custom font. Highlight Color ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number &H00000000 Returns the color of the highlighted text. Hint ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Text that should appear faintly in the input box to provide a hint as to what the user should enter. This can only be seen if the Text property is empty. Hint Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 Set a custom hint text color. Input Type ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 1 The input type you want for this TextBox. Multiline ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, then this text box accepts multiple lines of input, which are entered using the return key. For single line text boxes there is a Done key instead of a return key, and pressing Done hides the keyboard. The app should call the HideKeyboard method to hide the keyboard for a mutiline text box. Numbers Only (Not Working, Use Input Type) ¶ Deprecated Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False If true, then this text box accepts only numbers as keyboard input. Numbers can include a decimal point and an optional leading minus sign. This applies to keyboard input only. Even if NumbersOnly is true, you can use [set Text to] to enter any text at all. Read Only ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean False Whether the TextBox is read-only. By default, this is true. Rotation Angle ¶ Available as Advanced Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0.0 Sets the degrees that the textbox is rotated around the pivot point. Increasing values result in clockwise rotation. Text ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type text Returns the textbox contents. Text Alignment ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number 0 Whether the text should be left justified, centered, or right justified. By default, text is left justified. Text Color ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default number &HFF000000 The color for the text. You can choose a color by name in the Designer or in the Blocks Editor. The default text color is black. Visible ¶ Available as Common Property Read-Write property Type Default boolean True Returns true iff the component is visible. Column ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Column property getter method. Current Position ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Get the current cursor position. Enable Copy & Paste ¶ Deprecated Read-Write property Type Default boolean None DEPRECATED since this feature is not working. Use 'Enabled' instead. Height ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height, measured in pixels. Height Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's vertical height as a percentageof the height of its parent Component. Line Color ¶ Deprecated Read-Write property Type Default number None Please delete this block from your project.This block is deprecated and not longer supported. Row ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Row property getter method. Text Length ¶ Read-Only property Type Default number None Returns the current text length as number. Width ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width, measured in pixels. Width Percent ¶ Read-Write property Type Default number None Specifies the component's horizontal width as a percentageof the Width of its parent Component.
